channel.title: The Journey - Sermons (audio)
channel.description: At The Journey, Jesus is the heartbeat of everything we do. He's what makes us go, who we live for, the person that we orient our lives around. We want our church to embody his love for each other and our city. While the doctrines that express our faith in him aren't everything, they help give shape to our faith.

item.title: Solomon
item.description: "To guard your heart, you must know your heart." Solomon loved God and was rewarded with wisdom, wealth, and power, yet he failed to address the roots of sin in his heart, which eventually overtook him. In this sermon, Pastor Curtis Gilbert explains that though we're saved and sustained by God's grace, we must actively fight against sin, especially in the areas where we're most prone to drift.

item.title: David
item.description: David was called "a man after God's own heart", and yet he committed sins of adultery and murder. In this sermon, Darrin Patrick walks us through David's life, his sin, and his repentance, showing us how God's grace and Jesus' work on the cross—not our own religious attempts to atone for sin—are what hold the power to truly free us.

item.description: "The hardest thing to do in your life is to be content with your life." Coveting isn't simply about wanting what we don't have, but about where we place our hope. item.title: Resting in God
item.description: Pastor Darrin Patrick shows us that hurry is one of the biggest hindrances to knowing God, especially in our fast-paced culture. God has designed us to slow down and find rest in him. Taking a Sabbath means ceasing from duty and engaging in the things that bring us joy; it allows us to quiet our hearts and receive from God.

item.title: Trivializing God
item.description: Pastor Jeremy Irwin examines the Third Commandment and the paradox of grace and law. Just as boundaries help our human relationships to flourish, so the Law creates boundaries to lead us toward right relationship with God—allowing us to respond in obedience to the unmerited favor he's shown us.

item.title: Jesus as Threat
item.description: The world Jesus was born into during Herod's reign was full of injustice and cruelty. In that world Jesus never held a rank, a title, nor did he possess any governmental authority; he had no marks of worldly power, and yet he became the most powerful figure in human history. Pastor Jeremy Bedenbaugh reminds us that culture is always changing from one degree of turmoil to another, but that Jesus was "born for the mess", both then, and now.

item.title: Living by Promise
item.description: Pastor Darrin Patrick contrasts legalistic religion with the essence of true Christianity, which is rooted in grace. We learn that the purpose of the Law is not to save, but to reveal God's holiness, his perfection, and ultimately lead us to an understanding of our need for Jesus—through whom we can be saved.

item.title: Living by Faith
item.description: Pastor Darrin Patrick explains the difference between justification (Christ dying for our sins) and sanctification (Christ living in us to change us). Our standing and acceptance from God comes first by faith, while obedience follows through the help and strength of the Holy Spirit. When we take hold of this truth, we can use our faith practically to combat addiction, sin, and insecurity, knowing that we are dead to sin, but alive in Christ—that we have a power source at work within us, transforming our character to make us more and more like Jesus.
item.itunes:summary: Pastor Darrin Patrick explains the difference between justification (Christ dying for our sins) and sanctification (Christ living in us to change us). item.itunes:author: Darrin Patrick

item.title: Living in Paradox
item.description: Pastor Darrin Patrick elaborates on our inner desire to be "right" with God, showing how we often turn to our own moral law to try and earn his acceptance. We're urged to recall that justification comes only by grace through faith in Jesus, and that our "rightness" with God simply can't be earned or attained by any other means.

item.title: Your Story
item.description: Guest Speaker Yancey Arrington preaches from Ephesians 2. "And you were dead in the trespasses and sins in which you once walked, following the course of this world, following the prince of the power of the air, the spirit that is now at work in the sons of disobedience—among whom we all once lived in the passions of our flesh, carrying out the desires of the body and the mind, and were by nature children of wrath, like the rest of mankind. But God, being rich in mercy, because of the great love with which he loved us, even when we were dead in our trespasses, made us alive together with Christ—by grace you have been saved—and raised us up with him and seated us with him in the heavenly places in Christ Jesus, so that in the coming ages he might show the immeasurable riches of his grace in kindness toward us in Christ Jesus. For by grace you have been saved through faith. And this is not your own doing; it is the gift of God, not a result of works, so that no one may boast. For we are his workmanship, created in Christ Jesus for good works, which God prepared beforehand, that we should walk in them." (Ephesians 2:1-10 ESV)
item.itunes:summary: Guest Speaker Yancey Arrington preaches from Ephesians 2. But God, being rich in mercy, because of the great love with which he loved us, even when we were dead in our trespasses, made us alive together with Christ—by grace you have been saved—and raised us up with him and seated us with him in the heavenly places in Christ Jesus, so that in the coming ages he might show the immeasurable riches of his grace in kindness toward us in Christ Jesus. item.title: God is Good: We Don't Have to Look Elsewhere
item.description: "Coming to Jesus will expose your deepest pain, reveal your deepest need, and transform your deepest sin." Pastor Jeremy Bedenbaugh looks intently at John 4:7-30 and the story of the Samaritan woman at the well. We ultimately learn that Jesus uses our pain to draw us to himself. We can trust him because he backed his word by his work on the cross, enabling us to come to him as we are: sin, pain, and guilt included.

item.title: What We Can Become
item.description: Pastor Darrin Patrick introduces our summer schedule and provides vision for the upcoming Worship sermon series. From Acts 2:41-47. "The church is to be a people who participate as they embrace the gospel and live it out in love in the world. The church should not be a place where people come to consume as if it were a vender of religious goods and services." Dallas Williard "The biblical understanding of salvation is not merely that our lives and our world finally will be set right again. The biblical understanding of salvation is that our lives become swept up into something larger and greater than ourselves, into God's purposes for the world." James Brownson "The church is the only society in the world which exists for the benefit of those who are not its members." William Temple

item.title: The Pursuit: Serving God NOW
item.description:
"Remember also your Creator in the days of your youth, before the evil days come and the years draw near of which you will say, 'I have no pleasure in them'"(Ecclesiastes 12:1 ESV).
John Wesley defines "evil" in this context as "the time of old age, [which is] burdensome in itself, and far more grievous when it is loaded with the sad remembrance of youthful follies, and with the dreadful prospect of approaching death and judgment." The warning in the text is clear: Our bodies eventually fail and decay, while life's pleasures grow dim and unable to satisfy. Such wisdom should encourage us to sow seed for righteousness now.
item.itunes:summary:

item.title: Sex is Easy
item.description: While the "love lie" suggesting that sex is easy is one of the most pervasive in our culture, statistically, it's one of the easiest misconceptions to refute. In week one of our Love Lies series we learned that a staggering 20% of marriages are considered "sexless", or seriously lacking in physical intimacy. Last week we discussed that God's will for our marriages is that we operate as one with our spouses (sex included), not "face to face" (putting one another in front of God) but "shoulder to shoulder" (serving him together).
item.itunes:summary: While the "love lie" suggesting that sex is easy is one of the most pervasive in our culture, statistically, it's one of the easiest misconceptions to refute. Last week we discussed that God's will for our marriages is that we operate as one with our spouses (sex included), not "face to face" (putting one another in front of God) but "shoulder to shoulder" (serving him together).

item.title: How Can I Know God?
item.description: Knowing God is the most important thing that we can do as humans. Yet the activities that help us know him can also drive us away from him. In this sermon, Pastor Darrin Patrick unpacks the difference between religion and knowing God and explains how we can learn to be passionate in our love for Jesus and others.

item.title: Getting Your Eyes Off Yourself
item.description: The human impulse is to focus on its own needs, wants and desires. In this sermon we will see that only through Christ—his example and power—can we learn to put others before ourselves.

item.title: Generosity
item.description: When you have debt you are forced to focus your financial resources toward paying it down. The reality is that this distracts and impedes giving to the church and other ministry efforts. In this sermon, we will learn about avoiding and eliminating debt so that we might bless the world and honor God with our generosity.
item.itunes:summary: When you have debt you are forced to focus your financial resources toward paying it down. In this sermon, we will learn about avoiding and eliminating debt so that we might bless the world and honor God with our generosity.

item.title: Moving from Coveting to Contentment
item.description: Coveting is wanting stuff that we believe will ultimately satisfy us. In this sermon we will see that true contentment is realizing that no person or no thing will satisfy us—only Christ can satisfy.

item.description: Parenting is both a heavy burden and, potentially, a great reward. In this sermon we will see that the first step in godly parenting is to trust and listen to the Father who loves your children more than you do.

item.description: Your family of origin wasn't perfect, and for some of you it was downright awful. In this sermon we hear how breaking free from a broken begins with trusting that you've been adopted into God's family.

item.title: Forgiving Your Imperfect Parents
item.description: Forgiveness is hard because it is costly. And the closer the offender, the harder it is to forgive (flesh this out a little more). In this sermon we will see that forgiveness between a child and his or her parents actually begins by acknowledging the difficult sacrifice God made to forgive sinners.
item.itunes:summary: Forgiveness is hard because it is costly. And the closer the offender, the harder it is to forgive (flesh this out a little more). item.description: God intends for marriage to last a lifetime. In this sermon we will see that marriage longevity is only possible through a commitment to work through every argument and difficult circumstance together with God's help.

item.title: A Good Husband
item.description: Ephesians 5 reveals some heavy truths about the way men are instructed to love their wives. We cannot fix a marriage by making everything about marriage. Instead we must make everything about the gospel.
item.itunes:summary: Ephesians 5 reveals some heavy truths about the way men are instructed to love their wives. We cannot fix a marriage by making everything about marriage. Instead we must make everything about the gospel.
item.itunes:author: Darrin Patrick

item.title: Know Your Role: Helping & Headship
item.description: The Bible says that the husband is the first among equals in the covenant of marriage. Husbands are to be loving heads of their home by sacrificing and suffering most and forgiving first. Wives are to submit and respect their husbands just as they submit to and respect the head of the church, Christ. In this sermon, we will see how these seeming impossibilities become possible in Christ.
item.itunes:summary: The Bible says that the husband is the first among equals in the covenant of marriage. Husbands are to be loving heads of their home by sacrificing and suffering most and forgiving first. Wives are to submit and respect their husbands just as they submit to and respect the head of the church, Christ. In this sermon, we will see how these seeming impossibilities become possible in Christ.
item.itunes:author: Darrin and Amie Patrick

item.title: The Blueprint of Marriage
item.description: The blueprint of marriage is that we leave our parents, cling to our spouse as our first and best human friend, and connect emotionally, spiritually, and socially with them. This is covenant. This is marriage.
item.itunes:summary: The blueprint of marriage is that we leave our parents, cling to our spouse as our first and best human friend, and connect emotionally, spiritually, and socially with them. This is covenant. This is marriage.
item.itunes:author: Darrin Patrick

item.title: Sent to Love the City
item.description: We never fail God's tests, we just keep taking them. God commands Jonah a second time to call his enemies to repentance. In this sermon we will see that though Jonah repented of his self-righteous, there were deeper levels of it than even he knew.
item.itunes:summary: We never fail God's tests, we just keep taking them. God commands Jonah a second time to call his enemies to repentance. In this sermon we will see that though Jonah repented of his self-righteous, there were deeper levels of it than even he knew.
item.itunes:author: Darrin Patrick

item.title: The Great Rescue
item.description: Jonah repented of sin, by forsaking his idol of comfort and by appealing to God's grace. In this sermon we will see not only what this meant for Jonah, but what repenting of our idols means for us.
item.itunes:summary: Jonah repented of sin, by forsaking his idol of comfort and by appealing to God's grace. In this sermon we will see not only what this meant for Jonah, but what repenting of our idols means for us.
item.itunes:author: Darrin Patrick

item.title: You Can Run From God, but You Can't Outrun God
item.description: God called Jonah, a religious man, to go and love irreligious people. He didn't go because he didn't understand the gospel of grace. Neither do we.
item.itunes:summary: God called Jonah, a religious man, to go and love irreligious people. He didn't go because he didn't understand the gospel of grace. Neither do we.
item.itunes:author: Darrin Patrick

item.title: The Return of the King
item.description: The epic battle between good and evil, between God and Satan will one day come to an end. And Jesus, the Lamb of God who died and rose again, will be finally acknowledged as the victor.
item.itunes:summary: The epic battle between good and evil, between God and Satan will one day come to an end. And Jesus, the Lamb of God who died and rose again, will be finally acknowledged as the victor.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan McIntosh

item.title: Session 2 / Darrin Patrick
item.description: Acts 29 Midwest Quarterly - 8/17/10
item.itunes:summary: Acts 29 Midwest Quarterly - 8/17/10
item.itunes:author: Darrin Patrick

item.title: Session 3 / Alan Hirsch
item.description: Acts 29 Midwest Quarterly - 8/17/10
item.itunes:summary: Acts 29 Midwest Quarterly - 8/17/10
item.itunes:author: Alan Hirsch

item.title: Session 1 / Alan Hirsch
item.description: Acts 29 Midwest Quarterly - 8/17/10
item.itunes:summary: Acts 29 Midwest Quarterly - 8/17/10
item.itunes:author: Alan Hirsch

item.title: Contending for Truth
item.description: Sound doctrine, loving hearts, and an obedience to the purposes of Christ are the marks of a true Christian. If you don't have these things, you probably don't know Jesus...yet!
item.itunes:summary: Sound doctrine, loving hearts, and an obedience to the purposes of Christ are the marks of a true Christian. If you don't have these things, you probably don't know Jesus...yet!
item.itunes:author: Darrin Patrick

item.title: The Tension of Being a Christian
item.description: In the here and now we can expect trials to come. In the future we can expect Jesus to come back. Keeping an eternal perspective in mind allows us to see our suffering as a blessing from God.
item.itunes:summary: In the here and now we can expect trials to come. In the future we can expect Jesus to come back. Keeping an eternal perspective in mind allows us to see our suffering as a blessing from God.
item.itunes:author: Darrin Patrick

item.title: Doing the Word
item.description: James encourages Christians to back up their faith with actions. It is not enough to be a hearer of the word. A true Christian will be a doer of the word as well.
item.itunes:summary: James encourages Christians to back up their faith with actions. It is not enough to be a hearer of the word. A true Christian will be a doer of the word as well.
item.itunes:author: Darrin Patrick

item.title: Jesus Is Better
item.description: Packed with theological insights, the book of Hebrews puts Christ on full display, emphasizing that he is greater than any angel, prophet, or priest. Through his death Jesus provided the perfect sacrifice God required, a sacrifice that brings glory to God and eternal benefit to those who trust in the righteousness of Christ.
item.itunes:summary: Packed with theological insights, the book of Hebrews puts Christ on full display, emphasizing that he is greater than any angel, prophet, or priest. Through his death Jesus provided the perfect sacrifice God required, a sacrifice that brings glory to God and eternal benefit to those who trust in the righteousness of Christ.
item.itunes:author: Joel Lindsey

item.title: Gospel Forgiveness
item.description: Paul's letter to Philemon is a vivid portrait of how the gospel, and only the gospel, has the power to transform the hearts of people, to take us from "uselessness" to "usefulness."
item.itunes:summary: Paul's letter to Philemon is a vivid portrait of how the gospel, and only the gospel, has the power to transform the hearts of people, to take us from "uselessness" to "usefulness."
item.itunes:author: Bob Bickford

item.title: Leadership in the Church
item.description: In his letters to Timothy and Titus, Paul describes what church leaders should look like, and what hardships and rewards they should expect.
item.itunes:summary: In his letters to Timothy and Titus, Paul describes what church leaders should look like, and what hardships and rewards they should expect.
item.itunes:author: Darrin Patrick

item.title: Looking for Jesus
item.description: Paul's message to the Thessalonians is simple. Look back at what Christ has done to secure your salvation, and look forward to his second coming—the fulfillment of all the promises the Bible has made.
item.itunes:summary: Paul's message to the Thessalonians is simple. Look back at what Christ has done to secure your salvation, and look forward to his second coming—the fulfillment of all the promises the Bible has made.
item.itunes:author: Darrin Patrick

item.title: Colossians - Union With Christ
item.description: Paul wanted to drive home one message to the Colossians: Your union with Christ means you have a new identity. The "old you" is nothing compared to the "new you" in Christ.
item.itunes:summary: Paul wanted to drive home one message to the Colossians: Your union with Christ means you have a new identity. The "old you" is nothing compared to the "new you" in Christ.
item.itunes:author: Jeremy Irwin

item.title: Contentment
item.description: The letter to the Philippians is one of Paul's most encouraging messages to any New Testament church. This is made more amazing considering the fact that Paul wrote Philippians while in prison. In this sermon we will learn from Paul the "secret" of contentment—that Christ is sufficient to meet all our needs.
item.itunes:summary: The letter to the Philippians is one of Paul's most encouraging messages to any New Testament church. This is made more amazing considering the fact that Paul wrote Philippians while in prison. In this sermon we will learn from Paul the "secret" of contentment—that Christ is sufficient to meet all our needs.
item.itunes:author: Darrin Patrick

item.title: Ephesians - A Christian in the Church
item.description: Paul's letter to the church in Ephesus explores the heart of what it means to be Christian in the church. Paul defines what a Christian is, defines what a church is, and then articulates how Christians should relate in a church. In this sermon we find that the gospel infilitrates even our challenging, messy church relationships. Sins like gossip, anger, and conflict can be drowned with loving encouragement, grace, and forgiveness.
item.itunes:summary: Paul's letter to the church in Ephesus explores the heart of what it means to be Christian in the church. Paul defines what a Christian is, defines what a church is, and then articulates how Christians should relate in a church. In this sermon we find that the gospel infilitrates even our challenging, messy church relationships. Sins like gossip, anger, and conflict can be drowned with loving encouragement, grace, and forgiveness.
item.itunes:author: Darrin Patrick

item.title: Galatians - Freedom from Legalism
item.description: Continuing the study of the New Testament, Dangerous Words, Pastor Darrin Patrick gives an overview on the book of Galatians. The Apostle Paul's insights into the gospel and the human heart speak as strongly to the modern church as they did to the historical church. In this sermon, Pastor Darrin walks through how the truth of the gospel grants us freedom from slavery, sin, and death, but also freedom from legalism.
item.itunes:summary: Continuing the study of the New Testament, Dangerous Words, Pastor Darrin Patrick gives an overview on the book of Galatians. The Apostle Paul's insights into the gospel and the human heart speak as strongly to the modern church as they did to the historical church. In this sermon, Pastor Darrin walks through how the truth of the gospel grants us freedom from slavery, sin, and death, but also freedom from legalism.
item.itunes:author: Darrin Patrick

item.title: The Church at Corinth: A Clear Gospel for Broken People
item.description: Paul wrote 1st and 2nd Corinthians to a church much like The Journey in a city much like St. Louis. He was writing to a people who struggled to balance holiness and Christian freedom in a complex urban setting heavily influenced by popular culture. In this sermon we will look at Paul's love and concern for his people, which is overshadowed only by his love for and dedication to the One who died for him.
item.itunes:summary: Paul wrote 1st and 2nd Corinthians to a church much like The Journey in a city much like St. Louis. He was writing to a people who struggled to balance holiness and Christian freedom in a complex urban setting heavily influenced by popular culture. In this sermon we will look at Paul's love and concern for his people, which is overshadowed only by his love for and dedication to the One who died for him.
item.itunes:author: Darrin Patrick

item.title: Romans - The Only Righteousness That Matters
item.description: The book of Romans may be the most important book in the whole Bible because it so thoroughly articulates the gospel. In this sermon we will learn what it means that "the gospel is the power of God for salvation."
item.itunes:summary: The book of Romans may be the most important book in the whole Bible because it so thoroughly articulates the gospel. In this sermon we will learn what it means that "the gospel is the power of God for salvation."
item.itunes:author: Joel Lindsey

item.title: Jim Belcher - Introduction to Deep Church
item.description: What is the Deep Church? Who is the book written for? Why is a third way needed? Jim explains the contours of the emerging church, the traditional church push-back, and present a third way that moves beyond the two. To illustrate this third way, this session highlights deep worship, demonstrating how it moves behind the pitfalls of both emerging and traditional.
item.itunes:summary: What is the Deep Church? Who is the book written for? Why is a third way needed? Jim explains the contours of the emerging church, the traditional church push-back, and present a third way that moves beyond the two. To illustrate this third way, this session highlights deep worship, demonstrating how it moves behind the pitfalls of both emerging and traditional.
item.itunes:author: Jim Belcher

item.title: Acts - The Church on Mission
item.description: The early church—empowered by the power of the resurrected Christ—preached the gospels, planted churches and changed the world. In this sermon we will see how the story of the church of the past says everything about the church of the present and the future.
item.itunes:summary: The early church—empowered by the power of the resurrected Christ—preached the gospels, planted churches and changed the world. In this sermon we will see how the story of the church of the past says everything about the church of the present and the future.
item.itunes:author: Darrin Patrick

item.title: The Gospels - Revisiting WWJD
item.description: Jesus was born, lived, died and was resurrected. In this sermon, we will explore the "good news" presented in these four books.
item.itunes:summary: Jesus was born, lived, died and was resurrected. In this sermon, we will explore the "good news" presented in these four books.
item.itunes:author: Joel Lindsey

item.title: Introduction to the New Testament
item.description: The New Testament continues the story of God, who is rescuing his people, and who will demonstrate his ultimate power over Satan, sin and death. In this sermon we will see that all 27 books of the New Testament center on the person and work of Christ in and through the church.
item.itunes:summary: The New Testament continues the story of God, who is rescuing his people, and who will demonstrate his ultimate power over Satan, sin and death. In this sermon we will see that all 27 books of the New Testament center on the person and work of Christ in and through the church.
item.itunes:author: Darrin Patrick

item.title: Envy
item.description: Envy is when we want other people's stuff or even other people's life because we think it will bring more peace, joy and comfort than we are experiencing with our own stuff and our own life. In this sermon we will see that the true source of peace, joy and comfort is not found in stuff or even your own life, but in the future God provides because of what Christ has done.
item.itunes:summary: Envy is when we want other people's stuff or even other people's life because we think it will bring more peace, joy and comfort than we are experiencing with our own stuff and our own life. In this sermon we will see that the true source of peace, joy and comfort is not found in stuff or even your own life, but in the future God provides because of what Christ has done.
item.itunes:author: Darrin Patrick

item.title: Anger
item.description: We get angry when our stated or unstated goals are blocked. When we don't win, have influence, or feel like we're making progress, anger rears its ugly head. In this sermon we will see how forgiveness is the true source of power, and how in Christ we receive and extend it.
item.itunes:summary: We get angry when our stated or unstated goals are blocked. When we don't win, have influence, or feel like we're making progress, anger rears its ugly head. In this sermon we will see how forgiveness is the true source of power, and how in Christ we receive and extend it.
item.itunes:author: Darrin Patrick

item.title: Fear
item.description: Fear is the opposite of love. We fear because sin separated us from God's acceptance in the garden. In this sermon we will explore the reality that we are afraid that we will never be able to get God's acceptance back...because we can't. But Jesus did.
item.itunes:summary: Fear is the opposite of love. We fear because sin separated us from God's acceptance in the garden. In this sermon we will explore the reality that we are afraid that we will never be able to get God's acceptance back...because we can't. But Jesus did.
item.itunes:author: Darrin Patrick

item.title: Worry
item.description: Worry is the default mode of the human heart because we don't believe that God is in control. We worry because we try to secure the future. In this sermon we will learn to turn our worry into prayer, to renew our minds with the truth that God is in control.
item.itunes:summary: Worry is the default mode of the human heart because we don't believe that God is in control. We worry because we try to secure the future. In this sermon we will learn to turn our worry into prayer, to renew our minds with the truth that God is in control.
item.itunes:author: Darrin Patrick

item.title: Telling the Story
item.description: The job of the Christian is not to save people. Christians are ambassadors, messengers of King Jesus, bringing to others the good news he brought to us. In this sermon we will hear how being a new creation in Christ means you...yes, you...are an ambassador for Jesus.
item.itunes:summary: The job of the Christian is not to save people. Christians are ambassadors, messengers of King Jesus, bringing to others the good news he brought to us. In this sermon we will hear how being a new creation in Christ means you...yes, you...are an ambassador for Jesus.
item.itunes:author: Darrin Patrick

item.title: Restoration
item.description: The final chapter of the story of God has only been partially written. Jesus died, but was not defeated by death. He conquered Satan, sin and death by rising from his grave. In this sermon we will learn about the resurrection of Jesus and the hope that brings to all of God's children.
item.itunes:summary: The final chapter of the story of God has only been partially written. Jesus died, but was not defeated by death. He conquered Satan, sin and death by rising from his grave. In this sermon we will learn about the resurrection of Jesus and the hope that brings to all of God's children.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan McIntosh

item.title: Redemption
item.description: The climax of God's story is the redemption of God's people. Knowing his people would continue to rebel against him God intervened in human history in the person of Jesus. In this sermon we will examine the perfect life and atoning death of the Son of God.
item.itunes:summary: The climax of God's story is the redemption of God's people. Knowing his people would continue to rebel against him God intervened in human history in the person of Jesus. In this sermon we will examine the perfect life and atoning death of the Son of God.
item.itunes:author: Darrin Patrick

item.title: Fall
item.description: Though they enjoyed a perfect relationship with God, each other, and even the garden paradise God provided, Adam and Eve made a fatal choice to exchange their love of God for their love of self. In this sermon we will examine the sin of Adam and Eve and the implications of that sin for all of us.
item.itunes:summary: Though they enjoyed a perfect relationship with God, each other, and even the garden paradise God provided, Adam and Eve made a fatal choice to exchange their love of God for their love of self. In this sermon we will examine the sin of Adam and Eve and the implications of that sin for all of us.
item.itunes:author: Joel Lindsey

item.title: Prevailing Prayer
item.description: We are told that Elijah was a man "just like us." He certainly doesn’t look like us, but he is an outstanding example of prevailing prayer, and teaches us secrets that we do well to take on board so that we might become far more effective. James tells us in his epistle that we can learn from this man. Recorded at The Journey-Tower Grove on March 2, 2010.
item.itunes:summary: We are told that Elijah was a man "just like us." He certainly doesn’t look like us, but he is an outstanding example of prevailing prayer, and teaches us secrets that we do well to take on board so that we might become far more effective. James tells us in his epistle that we can learn from this man. Recorded at The Journey-Tower Grove on March 2, 2010.
item.itunes:author: Terry Virgo

item.title: Creation
item.description: The first chapter in the story of God shows God as the Creator of all that we see and all that we don't see. God also created human beings and loved them perfectly. In this sermon we will study the Creator and the relationship he has with his creation.
item.itunes:summary: The first chapter in the story of God shows God as the Creator of all that we see and all that we don't see. God also created human beings and loved them perfectly. In this sermon we will study the Creator and the relationship he has with his creation.
item.itunes:author: Darrin Patrick

item.title: Revelation
item.description: The Bible is not a book about rules to follow or things we need to do. The Bible is the story of God and what he has done on our behalf. In this sermon we begin our Foundations series by looking at the source of the story of God.
item.itunes:summary: The Bible is not a book about rules to follow or things we need to do. The Bible is the story of God and what he has done on our behalf. In this sermon we begin our Foundations series by looking at the source of the story of God.
item.itunes:author: Darrin Patrick

item.title: The Result
item.description: The result of a life of worship is a life of service. In this sermon we will see how spiritual disciplines deepen our worship of God, which fuels us for service in the church and beyond.
item.itunes:summary: The result of a life of worship is a life of service. In this sermon we will see how spiritual disciplines deepen our worship of God, which fuels us for service in the church and beyond.
item.itunes:author: Darrin Patrick

item.title: Basic Training
item.description: Some Christians pray as if God is a cosmic genie, granting wishes and doing the bidding of those who pray the most or the best. Others treat prayer like a fire alarm—PULL IN CASE OF EMERGENCY. In this sermon we will see that the Bible shows us a variety of ways not only to think about prayer but to actually pray.
item.itunes:summary: Some Christians pray as if God is a cosmic genie, granting wishes and doing the bidding of those who pray the most or the best. Others treat prayer like a fire alarm—PULL IN CASE OF EMERGENCY. In this sermon we will see that the Bible shows us a variety of ways not only to think about prayer but to actually pray.
item.itunes:author: Darrin Patrick

item.title: Where You Train
item.description: Jesus began his ministry with forty days of solitude. Before he ever performed a miracle or preached a sermon, he got away from people so he could get time with God. Jesus was a fan of solitude. In this sermon we will see why we should be fans too.
item.itunes:summary: Jesus began his ministry with forty days of solitude. Before he ever performed a miracle or preached a sermon, he got away from people so he could get time with God. Jesus was a fan of solitude. In this sermon we will see why we should be fans too.
item.itunes:author: Darrin Patrick

item.title: Why Train?
item.description: Discipline isn't sexy. It's not easy. It's early mornings. It's sacrifice. This is why most of us avoid discipline. In this sermon we will see that the key for a fuller experience of God may just be found in the disciplines we've been avoiding.
item.itunes:summary: Discipline isn't sexy. It's not easy. It's early mornings. It's sacrifice. This is why most of us avoid discipline. In this sermon we will see that the key for a fuller experience of God may just be found in the disciplines we've been avoiding.
item.itunes:author: Darrin Patrick

item.title: Engaging People
item.description: The two great commandments are loving God and loving people. In this sermon we will get practical about why we fail to love people well, who we tend to avoid, and how the Bible instructs us about loving people in a way that honors God.
item.itunes:summary: The two great commandments are loving God and loving people. In this sermon we will get practical about why we fail to love people well, who we tend to avoid, and how the Bible instructs us about loving people in a way that honors God.
item.itunes:author: Darrin Patrick

item.title: Engaging God
item.description: The new year has come and with it comes the Year of Engagement at The Journey. In this sermon we will hear from Pastor Darrin about what it looks like for the church to engage with God through the process of Spirit-led life renewal.
item.itunes:summary: The new year has come and with it comes the Year of Engagement at The Journey. In this sermon we will hear from Pastor Darrin about what it looks like for the church to engage with God through the process of Spirit-led life renewal.
item.itunes:author: Darrin Patrick

item.title: The Gift You Always Wanted
item.description: Pastor Joel Lindsey gives a brief Christmas Eve message about the birth of Jesus and the surprise of Christmas.
item.itunes:summary: Pastor Joel Lindsey gives a brief Christmas Eve message about the birth of Jesus and the surprise of Christmas.
item.itunes:author: Joel Lindsey

item.title: Repenting of Idolatry
item.description: As in our day, John’s contemporaries lived in a world permeated by idolatry. It is no surprise that John ends his letter warning against it. In this final sermon in 1 John, we will see how identifying and repenting of idols is key to worshiping the one true God.
item.itunes:summary: As in our day, John’s contemporaries lived in a world permeated by idolatry. It is no surprise that John ends his letter warning against it. In this final sermon in 1 John, we will see how identifying and repenting of idols is key to worshiping the one true God.
item.itunes:author: Darrin Patrick

item.title: Engaging God's World
item.description: Prayer is an exercise in faith, patience, obedience, and submission to the greater will and wisdom of God. In this sermon we will see the impact this has on what God has called us to do as ambassadors of Christ's gospel.
item.itunes:summary: Prayer is an exercise in faith, patience, obedience, and submission to the greater will and wisdom of God. In this sermon we will see the impact this has on what God has called us to do as ambassadors of Christ's gospel.
item.itunes:author: Darrin Patrick

item.title: Metro East Sermon: Believing Jesus
item.description: Faith is a word we all use. But it is a culturally loaded word that needs to be carefully defined. In this sermon we will look at what the Bible says about faith and how that faith leads to love, obedience, and overcoming the world. (Recorded at The Journey-Metro East Campus on December 6, 2009)
item.itunes:summary: Faith is a word we all use. But it is a culturally loaded word that needs to be carefully defined. In this sermon we will look at what the Bible says about faith and how that faith leads to love, obedience, and overcoming the world. (Recorded at The Journey-Metro East Campus on December 6, 2009)
item.itunes:author: Steve Mizel

item.title: Believing Jesus
item.description: The call to obey God's commands would be an unbearable burden if not for trust in the obedience of Christ. In this sermon we see that believing in Christ is the only way to experience the life God intends for us to live.
item.itunes:summary: The call to obey God's commands would be an unbearable burden if not for trust in the obedience of Christ. In this sermon we see that believing in Christ is the only way to experience the life God intends for us to live.
item.itunes:author: Bob Bickford

item.title: Planters, Pastors, & Churches That Love Their Neighborhoods
item.description: Session recorded at the Mercy Quarterly held at The Journey-St. Louis on September 14, 2009.
item.itunes:summary: Session recorded at the Mercy Quarterly held at The Journey-St. Louis on September 14, 2009.
item.itunes:author: Eric Mason

item.title: Missional Leadership: Moving Your Church To Mission
item.description: Session recorded at the Mercy Quarterly held at The Journey-St. Louis on September 14, 2009.
item.itunes:summary: Session recorded at the Mercy Quarterly held at The Journey-St. Louis on September 14, 2009.
item.itunes:author: Darrin Patrick

item.title: Growing in Love, Killing Fear
item.description: The Spirit that raised Jesus from the dead is the same Spirit that dwells in the heart of each follower of Jesus. In this sermon we will see that followers of Jesus can not only be assured of their eternal security, but can live confidently knowing that the love of God casts out all fear.
item.itunes:summary: The Spirit that raised Jesus from the dead is the same Spirit that dwells in the heart of each follower of Jesus. In this sermon we will see that followers of Jesus can not only be assured of their eternal security, but can live confidently knowing that the love of God casts out all fear.
item.itunes:author: Joel Lindsey

item.title: Love Casts Out Fear
item.description: In this sermon, we look at how life is full of fear - fear of God and fear of man. We also look at how God's perfect love casts out fear and enables us to walk in freedom. (Recorded at The Journey's Metro East Campus on Nov. 29, 2009.)
item.itunes:summary: In this sermon, we look at how life is full of fear - fear of God and fear of man. We also look at how God's perfect love casts out fear and enables us to walk in freedom. (Recorded at The Journey's Metro East Campus on Nov. 29, 2009.)
item.itunes:author: Steve Mizel

item.title: Discerning False Teaching
item.description: John reminds us that any teaching that lessens Christ’s unique and ultimate power over sin, death, and Satan is a lie. In this sermon we will also see that any teaching that begins and ends with the crucified, resurrected, and returning Lord is one to stake your life on.
item.itunes:summary: John reminds us that any teaching that lessens Christ’s unique and ultimate power over sin, death, and Satan is a lie. In this sermon we will also see that any teaching that begins and ends with the crucified, resurrected, and returning Lord is one to stake your life on.
item.itunes:author: Darrin Patrick

item.title: Defeating Doubt
item.description: John reminds us that we live in a dark world that opposes God at every turn. In this sermon we look at how the cross leads us to absolute confidence that our deepest needs and concerns are known by God and that our salvation is secure in his goodness.
item.itunes:summary: John reminds us that we live in a dark world that opposes God at every turn. In this sermon we look at how the cross leads us to absolute confidence that our deepest needs and concerns are known by God and that our salvation is secure in his goodness.
item.itunes:author: Darrin Patrick

item.title: Loving with Creeds and Deeds
item.description: The life of the believer is marked by love for others. In this sermon we will see that it is not enough to simply speak love, or to theorize about love, but that true love is borne out in action as well.
item.itunes:summary: The life of the believer is marked by love for others. In this sermon we will see that it is not enough to simply speak love, or to theorize about love, but that true love is borne out in action as well.
item.itunes:author: Darrin Patrick

item.title: Practicing What You Preach
item.description: Just as a child receives the nature of their parent, so does the believer receive the nature of his or her Parent in the form of the Holy Spirit. In this sermon we will see how it is the Spirit, not the best efforts of the believer, that ultimately helps us practice what we preach.
item.itunes:summary: Just as a child receives the nature of their parent, so does the believer receive the nature of his or her Parent in the form of the Holy Spirit. In this sermon we will see how it is the Spirit, not the best efforts of the believer, that ultimately helps us practice what we preach.
item.itunes:author: Darrin Patrick

item.title: Hating the World
item.description: John shocks his audience into reality by telling them not to love the world, which is a slightly more positive way of saying to hate the world. In this sermon we will explore John's warning to resist the lure of attractive lies of a dark world that attempts to deceive followers of Christ.
item.itunes:summary: John shocks his audience into reality by telling them not to love the world, which is a slightly more positive way of saying to hate the world. In this sermon we will explore John's warning to resist the lure of attractive lies of a dark world that attempts to deceive followers of Christ.
item.itunes:author: Darrin Patrick

item.title: Session One: Jeff Vanderstelt
item.description: Session one from the Acts 29 Midwest Quarterly held on October 20, 2009 at The Journey-Tower Grove.
item.itunes:summary: Session one from the Acts 29 Midwest Quarterly held on October 20, 2009 at The Journey-Tower Grove.
item.itunes:author: Jeff Vanderstelt

item.title: Session Two: Jeff Vanderstelt
item.description: Session two from the Acts 29 Midwest Quarterly held on October 20, 2009 at The Journey-Tower Grove.
item.itunes:summary: Session two from the Acts 29 Midwest Quarterly held on October 20, 2009 at The Journey-Tower Grove.
item.itunes:author: Jeff Vanderstelt

item.title: Growing Up In God
item.description: John uses a family metaphor to remind Christians that they are in a maturing process. In this sermon we will explore what it means to grow up in God.
item.itunes:summary: John uses a family metaphor to remind Christians that they are in a maturing process. In this sermon we will explore what it means to grow up in God.
item.itunes:author: Darrin Patrick

item.title: Loving the Unlovable
item.description: Knowing that you are beloved, despite your un-loveliness, is a key to understanding the gospel. In this sermon we will see how it is also a key to loving your brothers and sisters in Christ despite their un-loveliness.
item.itunes:summary: Knowing that you are beloved, despite your un-loveliness, is a key to understanding the gospel. In this sermon we will see how it is also a key to loving your brothers and sisters in Christ despite their un-loveliness.
item.itunes:author: Darrin Patrick

item.title: Obeying from Acceptance
item.description: John reminds us that knowing God and living in relationship with him is only possible through obedience to his truth. In this sermon we will examine the biblical reality that why you obey is as important as how you obey.
item.itunes:summary: John reminds us that knowing God and living in relationship with him is only possible through obedience to his truth. In this sermon we will examine the biblical reality that why you obey is as important as how you obey.
item.itunes:author: Darrin Patrick

item.title: Walking In The Light
item.description: Having true fellowship with God and people only happens when Christians walk in God's light. In this sermon we will examine all that it means to walk in the light of God.
item.itunes:summary: Having true fellowship with God and people only happens when Christians walk in God's light. In this sermon we will examine all that it means to walk in the light of God.
item.itunes:author: Darrin Patrick

item.title: Finding God at Church
item.description: The Bible provides overwhelming evidence that God intends for us to corporately worship Him in ways that honor Him and inspire, convict, and encourage us. In this sermon, we will look at how corporate worship is a vital part of experiencing the transforming power of the God who is mighty to save.
item.itunes:summary: The Bible provides overwhelming evidence that God intends for us to corporately worship Him in ways that honor Him and inspire, convict, and encourage us. In this sermon, we will look at how corporate worship is a vital part of experiencing the transforming power of the God who is mighty to save.
item.itunes:author: Darrin Patrick

item.title: Finding God in Brokenness
item.description: Jesus' encounter with the woman at the well is a key passage for understanding biblical worship. In this sermon we will look at how Jesus exposes our false solutions to unmet needs in order to show us that we have one basic need that only he can meet.
item.itunes:summary: Jesus' encounter with the woman at the well is a key passage for understanding biblical worship. In this sermon we will look at how Jesus exposes our false solutions to unmet needs in order to show us that we have one basic need that only he can meet.
item.itunes:author: Darrin Patrick

item.title: Making All of Life Worship
item.description: It's not if we worship, but what or whom do we worship? In this sermon, we will examine what it looks like to worship God with all that we are, in every area of our lives.
item.itunes:summary: It's not if we worship, but what or whom do we worship? In this sermon, we will examine what it looks like to worship God with all that we are, in every area of our lives.
item.itunes:author: Steve Miller

item.title: Hanley Road: All of Life is Worship
item.description: The key difference between authentic and fake worship is an understanding of the mercy of God.
item.itunes:summary: The key difference between authentic and fake worship is an understanding of the mercy of God.
item.itunes:author: Steve Mizel

item.title: Awareness
item.description: What you worship is what consumes you. You either worship God or something in the place of God. In this sermon, we learn how to worship by receiving God as He is, by discerning how He works and by responding to His will.
item.itunes:summary: What you worship is what consumes you. You either worship God or something in the place of God. In this sermon, we learn how to worship by receiving God as He is, by discerning how He works and by responding to His will.
item.itunes:author: Darrin Patrick

item.title: Growing in Grace
item.description: Peter closes his letter by pointing his readers to the grace of the gospel.
item.itunes:summary: Peter closes his letter by pointing his readers to the grace of the gospel.
item.itunes:author: Darrin Patrick

item.title: Hanley Road: Living for the End
item.description: What will happen when the world ends - if it ever does? In this sermon, we'll see how a healthy view of the end of all things can give us a faith that both adequately prepares us to die tonight, and to live to tomorrow to make the better world a better place.
item.itunes:summary: What will happen when the world ends - if it ever does? In this sermon, we'll see how a healthy view of the end of all things can give us a faith that both adequately prepares us to die tonight, and to live to tomorrow to make the better world a better place.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan McIntosh

item.title: Tower Grove: The Day You Never Knew You Wanted
item.description: Have you ever cringed at the thought of Judgment Day as it is described in the Bible? What if Judgment Day was not a day to fear, but actually the day you've been longing for your whole life. In this sermon, we will explore the hope found in Jesus' return to judge his creation.
item.itunes:summary: Have you ever cringed at the thought of Judgment Day as it is described in the Bible? What if Judgment Day was not a day to fear, but actually the day you've been longing for your whole life. In this sermon, we will explore the hope found in Jesus' return to judge his creation.
item.itunes:author: Joel Lindsey

item.title: False Teachers
item.description: Peter tells us that false teachers will arise in the church, spreading heresies and using their influence to manipulate & seduce out of a desire for selfish gain. In this sermon, we will find out how to discern false teachers & false teaching.
item.itunes:summary: Peter tells us that false teachers will arise in the church, spreading heresies and using their influence to manipulate & seduce out of a desire for selfish gain. In this sermon, we will find out how to discern false teachers & false teaching.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan McIntosh

item.title: Spirituality for Amnesiacs
item.description: The Bible tells us that we have spiritual amnesia and easily forget who God is and what he has done for us. In this sermon, we see that Peter gives us a two-part antidote in order that we may be constantly reminded of the truth of the Gospel.
item.itunes:summary: The Bible tells us that we have spiritual amnesia and easily forget who God is and what he has done for us. In this sermon, we see that Peter gives us a two-part antidote in order that we may be constantly reminded of the truth of the Gospel.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan McIntosh

item.title: Growth
item.description: In the first few verses of 2 Peter, Peter tells us how to grow in our faith. In this sermon we will learn how God grows us into maturity.
item.itunes:summary: In the first few verses of 2 Peter, Peter tells us how to grow in our faith. In this sermon we will learn how God grows us into maturity.
item.itunes:author: Darrin Patrick

item.title: Metro East: Dating and Marriage
item.description: A challenging look at how Christ-followers can date well and become men and women who will marry well.
item.itunes:summary: A challenging look at how Christ-followers can date well and become men and women who will marry well.
item.itunes:author: Steve Mizel

item.title: West County: Peter - A Life Changed By The Gospel
item.description: We all feel the weight of wanting to change. In this sermon, we will look at what the Bible says about God's plan for change, why we need it, and how Peter experienced the deepest kind of change.
item.itunes:summary: We all feel the weight of wanting to change. In this sermon, we will look at what the Bible says about God's plan for change, why we need it, and how Peter experienced the deepest kind of change.
item.itunes:author: Adam Dressler

item.title: Hanley Road: Give Up (Trying To Be Good Enough)
item.description: The Bible tells a unified story with a unified theme, and at its heart is the beautiful yet gruesome reality of what God will go through to rescue human beings.
item.itunes:summary: The Bible tells a unified story with a unified theme, and at its heart is the beautiful yet gruesome reality of what God will go through to rescue human beings.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan McIntosh

item.title: Tower Grove: A Substitute Has Been Provided
item.description: These verses give us a straightforward look at the heart of the gospel: that a sinless man died to provide sinners access to the God who loves them.
item.itunes:summary: These verses give us a straightforward look at the heart of the gospel: that a sinless man died to provide sinners access to the God who loves them.
item.itunes:author: Joel Lindsey

item.title: The Kind of Leader God Uses
item.description: Leaders are called to be worthy of imitation. They are called to lead out of humility. In this sermon, we will learn how to do this.
item.itunes:summary: Leaders are called to be worthy of imitation. They are called to lead out of humility. In this sermon, we will learn how to do this.
item.itunes:author: Darrin Patrick

item.title: Suffering Well by Being The Church
item.description: The only way we make it through suffering is to have a clear head. In this sermon we will learn how to be clear-minded as the church for the world.
item.itunes:summary: The only way we make it through suffering is to have a clear head. In this sermon we will learn how to be clear-minded as the church for the world.
item.itunes:author: Darrin Patrick

item.title: Suffering Well by Arming Yourself
item.description: The majority of Americans spend enormous energy on isolating themselves from suffering and by pursuing a low-maintenance, hassle-free life. In this sermon we will learn to repent of our Americanism.
item.itunes:summary: The majority of Americans spend enormous energy on isolating themselves from suffering and by pursuing a low-maintenance, hassle-free life. In this sermon we will learn to repent of our Americanism.
item.itunes:author: Darrin Patrick

item.title: The Missional Church
item.description: The word ‘missional’ is currently is a hip term thrown around a lot among Christians. The Journey calls itself a missional church – but what does that mean? In this sermon, 1 Peter shows us what it means by what our posture is towards the world that is sometimes hostile towards our faith.
item.itunes:summary: The word ‘missional’ is currently is a hip term thrown around a lot among Christians. The Journey calls itself a missional church – but what does that mean? In this sermon, 1 Peter shows us what it means by what our posture is towards the world that is sometimes hostile towards our faith.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan McIntosh

item.title: West County: Suffering, Confusion, and God’s Will
item.description: When we suffer, we can become disoriented about our lives, our future, and God. In this sermon, we will look at how Peter addresses the confusion of his readers and what encouragement he offers them instead.
item.itunes:summary: When we suffer, we can become disoriented about our lives, our future, and God. In this sermon, we will look at how Peter addresses the confusion of his readers and what encouragement he offers them instead.
item.itunes:author: Adam Dressler

item.title: Building A Missional Marriage
item.description: Marriage is hard, but it also has more potential than any other relationship to bring glory to God and to paint a picture to the world of the gospel. In this sermon, we will examine specific instruction to husbands and wives on how to build a missional marriage.
item.itunes:summary: Marriage is hard, but it also has more potential than any other relationship to bring glory to God and to paint a picture to the world of the gospel. In this sermon, we will examine specific instruction to husbands and wives on how to build a missional marriage.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan McIntosh

item.title: Loving God by Submitting to Government
item.description: God puts authority over our lives to teach, protect and correct us. Our responsibilty is to submit to and honor authority. In this sermon we will learn how.
item.itunes:summary: God puts authority over our lives to teach, protect and correct us. Our responsibilty is to submit to and honor authority. In this sermon we will learn how.
item.itunes:author: Darrin Patrick

item.title: Loving God by Being the People of God
item.description: The heart of God is that the church serve as the advertisement for who God is. In this sermon, we will learn how to be a church that makes Jesus attractive to the world. (1 Peter 1:22-2:12)
item.itunes:summary: The heart of God is that the church serve as the advertisement for who God is. In this sermon, we will learn how to be a church that makes Jesus attractive to the world. (1 Peter 1:22-2:12)
item.itunes:author: Darrin Patrick

item.title: Hanley Road: How to Respond to Your Critics
item.description: Recently, critics of Christianity have used the language of marginalization to try to shame and denigrate believers. This kind of rhetoric is increasing in our culture. In this sermon, we'll look at how we are called to respond to a world that can be hostile toward our faith. (1 Peter 1:22 - 2:12)
item.itunes:summary: Recently, critics of Christianity have used the language of marginalization to try to shame and denigrate believers. This kind of rhetoric is increasing in our culture. In this sermon, we'll look at how we are called to respond to a world that can be hostile toward our faith. (1 Peter 1:22 - 2:12)
item.itunes:author: Jonathan McIntosh

item.title: Loving God by Applying The Gospel
item.description: How do we actually become holy? The answer may surprise you. In this sermon, we will examine the tension between fear & love, discovering real power for authentic godliness.
item.itunes:summary: How do we actually become holy? The answer may surprise you. In this sermon, we will examine the tension between fear & love, discovering real power for authentic godliness.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan McIntosh

item.title: West County: Calling on God in the Midst of Our Suffering
item.description: The Gospel makes a difference in every area of our lives – even our suffering. In this sermon, we will look at how we can suffer well in light of who God is and what he asks us to do in our troubles.
item.itunes:summary: The Gospel makes a difference in every area of our lives – even our suffering. In this sermon, we will look at how we can suffer well in light of who God is and what he asks us to do in our troubles.
item.itunes:author: Adam Dressler

Ed will be providing insight and guidance based on his newly released book Lost & Found: The Younger Church & The Churches That Reach Them. item.title: Session Two: Loving God By Looking Into The Gospel
item.description: Most people think that thinking and Christianity do not go together. In this sermon we will learn how God wants us to think deeply about the Gospel and its implications for our lives. This media was recorded live at the Acts 29 Quarterly held at The Journey-St. Louis on April 28, 2009.
item.itunes:summary: Most people think that thinking and Christianity do not go together. In this sermon we will learn how God wants us to think deeply about the Gospel and its implications for our lives. This media was recorded live at the Acts 29 Quarterly held at The Journey-St. Louis on April 28, 2009.
item.itunes:author: Darrin Patrick

item.title: Loving God By Looking Into The Gospel
item.description: Most people think that thinking and Christianity do not go together. In this sermon we will learn how God wants us to think deeply about the Gospel and its implications for our lives.
item.itunes:summary: Most people think that thinking and Christianity do not go together. In this sermon we will learn how God wants us to think deeply about the Gospel and its implications for our lives.
item.itunes:author: Darrin Patrick

item.title: Loving God in Your Suffering
item.description: Most of the time when we are suffering the question we ask is, "why God is this happening?". In this sermon, we will learn to ask "what God are you teaching me?"
item.itunes:summary: Most of the time when we are suffering the question we ask is, "why God is this happening?". In this sermon, we will learn to ask "what God are you teaching me?"
item.itunes:author: Darrin Patrick

item.title: Peter's Transformation
item.description: Peter didn't just experience the ministry or the teachings of Christ, he experienced the resurrected Christ. In this sermon, we will see how the resurrection can transform us.
item.itunes:summary: Peter didn't just experience the ministry or the teachings of Christ, he experienced the resurrected Christ. In this sermon, we will see how the resurrection can transform us.
item.itunes:author: Darrin Patrick

item.title: Hanley Road: Peter Meets Jesus
item.description: In this introduction to 1 Peter, we’ll see why a meeting with the resurrected Jesus changed Peter from a spiritual halfwit to a man on mission and why we need an encounter with Jesus to have any hope for our lives or for our world.
item.itunes:summary: In this introduction to 1 Peter, we’ll see why a meeting with the resurrected Jesus changed Peter from a spiritual halfwit to a man on mission and why we need an encounter with Jesus to have any hope for our lives or for our world.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan McIntosh

item.title: Enjoy
item.description: Contentment is both commanded and promised by God to those who would seek God. In this sermon we will look at the key to enjoying our lives.
item.itunes:summary: Contentment is both commanded and promised by God to those who would seek God. In this sermon we will look at the key to enjoying our lives.
item.itunes:author: Darrin Patrick

item.title: Repay
item.description: Credit card debt has become for many in our generation a house of bondage. In this sermon, we will see what God has to say about the slavery of debt and what practically to do about it.
item.itunes:summary: Credit card debt has become for many in our generation a house of bondage. In this sermon, we will see what God has to say about the slavery of debt and what practically to do about it.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan McIntosh

item.title: West County: Debt and Freedom
item.description: Debt is about more than just money. In this sermon, we will look at what the Bible says about debt and how God ultimately wants to give us freedom.
item.itunes:summary: Debt is about more than just money. In this sermon, we will look at what the Bible says about debt and how God ultimately wants to give us freedom.
item.itunes:author: Adam Dressler

item.title: West County: Saving In the Kingdom
item.description: God calls us to be wise managers of our money. In this sermon, we will look at how saving fits into an overall plan for managing our money under the Kingdom.
item.itunes:summary: God calls us to be wise managers of our money. In this sermon, we will look at how saving fits into an overall plan for managing our money under the Kingdom.
item.itunes:author: Adam Dressler

item.title: Save
item.description: Though the Bible doesn’t speak exhaustively to the issue of saving, it does deal with the main reason why we don’t: Greed.
item.itunes:summary: Though the Bible doesn’t speak exhaustively to the issue of saving, it does deal with the main reason why we don’t: Greed.
item.itunes:author: Darrin Patrick

item.title: Hanley Road: Generosity Heals the World
item.description: The universe runs on it. God overflows with it. And at the heart of the Christian message – there it is. In this sermon, we discover the secret to living a life marked by generosity.
item.itunes:summary: The universe runs on it. God overflows with it. And at the heart of the Christian message – there it is. In this sermon, we discover the secret to living a life marked by generosity.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan McIntosh

item.title: Give
item.description: Nobody wants to hear the preacher talk about giving. The issue with giving is an issue with generosity. In this sermon we will learn how to be generous.
item.itunes:summary: Nobody wants to hear the preacher talk about giving. The issue with giving is an issue with generosity. In this sermon we will learn how to be generous.
item.itunes:author: Darrin Patrick

item.title: Plan
item.description: The issue with most people’s financial woes is a lack of financial planning. In this sermon we will learn how to plan by being under the Spirit’s control.
item.itunes:summary: The issue with most people’s financial woes is a lack of financial planning. In this sermon we will learn how to plan by being under the Spirit’s control.
item.itunes:author: Darrin Patrick

item.title: Hanley Road: What Do You Value?
item.description: What does God value? What is important to Him? In this sermon, we’ll see that just like with God, our plans – even with our finances – reflect what we truly value.
item.itunes:summary: What does God value? What is important to Him? In this sermon, we’ll see that just like with God, our plans – even with our finances – reflect what we truly value.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan McIntosh

item.title: Gospel Community: We Can Connect With People
item.description: Human beings were made to be in relationship with others. We were made to reflect God who is in an eternal community. In this sermon we look at what keeps us from doing what we were made to do in relationships.

item.description: There is no possibility of worshipping nothing. We are all worshippers. In this sermon we will learn to repent of worshipping lesser gods and to worship the one true God.

item.title: Gospel Identity: We Belong to Jesus
